meta.name: title
meta.content: Widener Partnership Charter School | Widener University

meta.name: description
meta.content: Widener Partnership Charter School challenges K-8 students to become self-motivated and lifelong-learners and aims to contribute to the good of society.

meta.name: abstract
meta.content: Widener Partnership Charter School challenges students to become self-motivated and lifelong-learners. The Kâ€“8 school aims to educate its students to become citizens who can contribute to the good of society.

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: widener partnership charter school, charter school, widener charter school, education, widener education, partnership charter school, wpcs
Widener Partnership Charter School challenges K-8 students to become self-motivated and lifelong-learners and aims to contribute to the good of society.

link.title: Widener Partnership Charter School | Widener University

img.alt: widener partnership charter school classroom students

div.p: Widener Partnership Charter School challenges students to become self-motivated and lifelong learners. The Kâ€“8 school aims to educate its students to become citizens who can contribute to the good of society.

div.button:
More in this sectionâ€¦
Click to expose navigation links on mobile.

li.a: Widener Intimacy, Sexuality, Education, and Relationships Clinic

div.p: Located next to our mainÂ campus, theÂ Widener Partnership Charter SchoolÂ (WPCS) is Pennsylvaniaâ€™s first university-based charter school.Â We launched the charter school in 2006 in partnership with community leaders and residents of Chester. It takes a holistic approach to K-8 education, equipping the next generation with skills and resources to succeed.

As a Widener student, you will gain invaluable real-world experience in the school, preparing you for your future profession. As anÂ early childhood / special educationÂ major, you can conduct a field placement there, supporting and enhancing the instruction of classroom teachers.
As a graduate student in ourÂ social work,Â clinical psychology, or physical therapyÂ programs, you can provide a range of support services to charter school children and their families.

Widener Partnership Charter School alumni who meet our admission criteria during their high school years are eligible for grants of $100,000 over four years to pursue an undergraduate education full time at Widener.

img.alt: widener partnership charter school students teacher

div.p: The mission of the Widener Partnership Charter School is to develop urban elementary (K-8) students with the behaviors, task commitment, and creativity to succeed in the current educational environment. Through holistic cultivation of childrenâ€™s resources, WPCS will enable students to become self-motivated, competent, and lifelong learners.
